verse: कृष्णो ह वै हरिः परमो देवः षड्विधैश्वर्यपरिपूर्णो भगवान् गोपीगोपसेव्यो वृन्दाराधितो वृन्दावनाधिनाथः स एक एवेश्वरः तस्य ह वै द्वैततनुर्नारायणोऽखिलब्रह्माण्डाधिपतिरेकोंऽशः प्रकृतेः प्राचीनो नित्यः । एवं हि तस्य शक्तयस्त्वनेकधा । आह्लादिनीसंधिनीज्ञानेच्छाक्रियाद्या बहुविधाः शक्तयः । तास्वाह्लादिनी वरीयसी

terms.कृष्णो ह वै हरिः परमो देवः: Krishna is the supreme deity, Hari.
terms.षड्विधैश्वर्यपरिपूर्णो भगवान्: He is complete with six types of divine opulence.
terms.गोपीगोपसेव्यो वृन्दाराधितो वृन्दावनाधिना: He is worshipped by the cowherd girls and the cowherd boys, and is the Lord of Vrindavan.
terms.स एक एवेश्वरः: He is the one and only supreme lord.
terms.तस्य ह वै द्वैततनुः नारायणः अखिलब्रह्माण: He, in His dual form, is known as Narayana, the ruler of the entire universe.
terms.एकोऽशः प्रकृतेः प्राचीनो नित्यः: He is eternal, ancient, and the primal source of all.
terms.एवं हि तस्य शक्तयः तास्वाह्लादिनी वरीयसी: Similarly, His powers are of various types, among which the power of bliss (ahladini shakti) is the greatest.

meaning: Meaning:These verses describe the attributes and nature of Lord Krishna. He is identified as the supreme deity, Hari, who possesses six kinds of divine opulence. He is worshipped by the cowherd girls and boys in Vrindavan, and He is the ultimate ruler of the universe. Krishna, in His dual form as Narayana, is considered the eternal source of all existence. His powers manifest in various ways, with the power of bliss being the highest among them.
